page.title: 03 Ecology: Flora
page.content: Scrub oak,birch,ash,mountain ash, hazel, alder, sycamore, sloe, bog asphodel and bog myrtle, crack willow and beech grow wild. In the areas cultivated by the Forestry Commission are Scots pine, larch, Sitka spruce and Douglas fir surrounded by borders of deciduous woodland. Bracken, heather, bramble, bilberry, gorse, primrose, bluebell, violet, foxglove, honeysuckle, sundew, butterwort, orchid, globe flower, cuckoo pint, and wild garlic are found here. There are mosses, lichens, ferns and fungi in variety. The usual hedgerow flowers are to be seen by the roadside. Indian or Himalayan balsam is spreading up the valley along the river banks.
